item.title: Web App - UI/UX optimization
item.description: In UAT testing now. Also fixed some UX experience based on Users feedback. Click cards in Introduction page, now will go to next step. Fixed double title when scrolling the card explanation. Fixed the English explanation oversized in card. Optimized the UI effect in button. Fixed some special characters in card explanation.

item.title: Web App - Refactor by Next.js + Optimize UX flow
item.description: In UAT testing now. Also fixed some UX experience based on Users feedback. Fixed lag animation and optimization performance (remove transition all). Removed confused Poe description. Switch the step of meditation and choose spread. Deploy service to new domain. Optimized SEO by using Next.js to refactor service.

item.title: Developed Web App
item.description: Embarking on the journey of learning frontend software technologies and developing the Miri web version using React.js. For this version, UI flow is designed using Figma, and the content originally present in the Line chatbot is reconstructed for the web. Additionally, Tarot card divination explanations are made available. The Line and Telegram chatbots may eventually become part of history.

item.title: [Back-end skill] How to use Black Duck and Fortify On Demand APIs? (with Python Requests and Postman
item.description: We have a lengthy security detection flow need to pass before each time we have new release to production, in the part of this flow, there are Black Duck and Fortify On Demand scans.

item.title: [Solutions] Research the lengthy security detection flow of product release, design and propose automating solutions (Fortify on Demand and Black Duck scans)
item.description: This automation solutions was my research for the last half year of my time at this company.

item.title: [Front-end] Use CSS linear-gradient and Figma export SVG file develop simple starry night background effect.
item.description: When I’m developing my self software service, there is a background with stars and nights effect.

item.title: [Front-end] How to change CSS background color if use linear-gradient effect?
item.description: Since I’m developing my own product and using a lot of gradient color as background color, as a new Front-end learner, this issue stuck me a while, so I would like to share the solution I found.

item.title: [Back-end] Resolve CORS issue research note (Python FastAPI + Firebase/Firestore)
item.description: Recent, I’m developing my tarot app and it needs to send HTTP requests to back-end API. I face CORS issue several times, but I forgot how to resolve each time, so in this post, I will record the resolution.

item.title: [Back-end] How to use Python send requests to Jira APIs (Create and Get Ticket, Leave Comment and Upload Attachments)
item.description: Jira is a web service developed by Atlassian for project management.

item.title: [Back-end Tech] Research on Amazon Neptune Database and Data Visualization
item.description: Amazon Neptune Graph Database and Data Visualization is the topic we want to research in this cross-ream collaboration in our company.

item.title: [Product Development Diary] The future plan of Miri | Series(3) | Story
item.description:
I always think, as a software engineer, what’s my dream? What’s my next target and task?

For me, dream and objectives are the important power for keeping motivation and enthusiasm, if the dream is hard to achieve, and it will be the best point to keep learning and doing.

item.title: [Product Development Diary] The third version of Miri | The development life in this half year | Series(2) | Story
item.description:
Recalling this life period, it seems all things are just happened yesterday, time passed quickly.

The experience of this period gave me big harvest, although I used to doubt my decision, but I insisted to keep it until finish.

item.title: [Product Development Diary] The motivation and origin of Miri | Series(1) | Story
item.description:
I wrote the story of how Miri was conceived in the Github README originally.

But when I recently completed the development of the third version and was about to rewrite the README, I found that I should move the description here, plus I want to record my motivation and story of making Miri.

item.title: Line Chatbot x Telegram Chatbot - Create additional 5 new divination methods
item.description: Following the completion of the second job experience, version 1.2 introduced a Telegram chatbot version. In addition to the existing Runes divination method, six new divination methods were added: Runes, Tarot Card Reading, Lenormand Card Reading, Temple Poe (筊杯), Nature Whispers Phrase Cards, and Inspirational Wisdom Sentences. The Tarot Card Reading feature in this version is limited to card drawing, with no available interpretations.

item.title: Somos Familia - Una chica asiática contacta con la cultura española (2)
item.description:
Cuando podemos volver a casa?

Aqui no es mi casa, no me siento comodo aqui y me siento mi familia no estan comodos también

Todos cambiaron...

item.title: Somos Familia - Una chica asiática contacta con la cultura española (1)
Line Chatbot - Developed Rune divination
item.description: Following the first job experience, version 1.1 saw Miri redefining its focus as an online fortune-telling and divination service. The initial divination method, Runes divnation, was introduced in the Line chatbot version.

item.title: Create Line Chatbot
item.description: Miri Robot fortune-teller, was originally conceived as a chatbot, and the initial version was developed as a Line chatbot. The name Miri was chosen as a homage to Apple’s Siri.
